questions.uddipok: Following is a bar diagram containing data on internet users of Bangladesh from 2014 to 2019. The numbers are in millions. Analyze the graph.

sub_questions.explanation: The bar graph illustrates the steady increase in the number of internet users in Bangladesh from 2014 to 2019. The graph shows that in 2014, there were around 40 million users, which increased to approximately 60 million by 2015. Then, the number of users suddenly decreased and reached 50 million in 2016. Only this particular year marks a decrease in the number of users. Then, a significant surge occurred in 2017 and the number of internet users jumped to 70 million. This marks an increase highlighting a rapid growth in internet accessibility and usage. The number of users remained same in 2018. Finally, in 2019, the number of internet users took another jump and turned into 80 million in total. Analysing the graph, we find that within five years, the number of internet users in Bangladesh increased significantly, making it double. It is a clear indication that during this period, the country's digital infrastructure improved significantly. It also shows that people of Bangladesh are. getting accustomed to the modern technologies.

questions.uddipok:
Complete the following story following the clue.
There lived two brothers in a village. After their father's death, they inherited three things a cow, a plam tree and a blanket. They were Ali and Bashir. Ali, the younger was being exploited by the elder brother, Bashir. Bashir was very cunning.........

sub_questions.explanation:
Grasp All Lose All
There were two brothers in a village. One was Karim by name and the other was Bashir. Karim was elder brother of Bashir. They began to grow up gradually. Suddenly their father died. They fell in problem to some extent. Karim was cleverer than Bashir. On the other hand, Bashir was very simple and honest. Karim always made his brother do difficult works and himself did not do anything. They had two things. One was a cow and the other was a palm tree. One day the two brothers divided their properties. Karim cleverly took the back part of the cow and gave the front to his brother. In the same way, Karim himself took the top of the palm tree and gave the bottom to his brother. Karim began to enjoy the benefit of the properties. But Bashir was deprived of getting any advantage. Karim began to drink milk and juice, of the palm tree. One day a wise man in the village, advised Bashir to cut down the palm tree of his own portion and stop feeding the cow. Then the problem was solved.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Mushfiq/Musfiqa and your friend is Sharif/Sharifa. Now, write a letter to your friend telling him/her what she/he intends to do after the HSC examination and why.

sub_questions.explanation:
Subject: My Post-HSC Plans
Dear Sharif,
Hope this letter finds you well.
I'm writing to share my plans for after the HSC exams. I've been giving it a lot of thought and I'm excited about the possibilities that lie ahead.
After completing my HSC, I intend to pursue a degree in Computer Science. I've always been fascinated by technology and the endless possibilities it offers. I believe that a degree in Computer Science will equip me with the necessary skills to contribute to the field and pursue a fulfilling career.
The rapid advancements in technology have made it an exciting and dynamic field to be a part of. I'm particularly interested in exploring areas like artificial intelligence, machine learning, and software development. I envision myself working on innovative projects that have a positive impact on society.
Furthermore, a degree in Computer Science opens up a wide range of career opportunities. I could work in software development, IT consulting, data analysis, or even research. The possibilities are endless, and I'm eager to explore them all.
I'm confident that pursuing a degree in Computer Science will be a rewarding and fulfilling journey. I'm excited to embark on this new chapter in my life and see where it takes me.
I'd love to hear about your plans for after the HSC. What are you thinking of doing?
Best regards,
Mushfiq
Rajshahi, Bangladesh

sub_questions.explanation: Do you know about Nishat? Actually, Nishat Mazumder, a Bangladeshi woman in her early forties, is a sports icon. She comes of a modest background; her father is a businessman and her mother is a housewife. She is the second of four siblings. She is not very tall or well built, or does not have a charming princess look; but this apparently ordinary girl has three things that she can be proud of. questions.uddipok:
Write a summary of the following passage.
Education aims to bring about positive changes in our behavior. It helps us try to change our lives as well as the society we live in. Education that does not illuminate our minds or does not inspire us to work for the community is not complete at all. Education is not all about getting grades or receiving certificates- we use education to make life better. We are expected to apply the knowledge, skills and values that we learn in a classroom in our engagement with the world that lies outside. And we can do so in many different ways. Let's have a look at how education works. Learners' civic engagement is highly appreciated all over the world. Civic engagement means working to make a difference in the civic life (the public life of the citizens as constructed with private or personal life) of the community using knowledge, skills, values and motivation. Civic engagement promotes the quality of life in a community by contributing to the improvement of health and wellbeing of the people.
Civically engaged individuals recognize themselves as members of a larger social community and are concerned about civic issues. They consider themselves responsible citizens who take action or raise their voices against injustice, discrimination and other forms of social ills.
In civic engagement, issues of public concern are crucial. Civic engagement includes individual or group activities to protect public interests and change the way the community values itself. For example, If you are protesting against any unjust decision of the local municipality such as raising taxes or an act that might work against people's interests, you are civically engaged and your action is considered a civic engagement. This protest can be done in different ways such as organizing rallies, collecting signatures, making human chains, writing petitions, etc. You can also help control traffic in front of a school, help children to cross the roads, work in a team to clean a park or a sea beach. You can also give some services to elderly people. These are all examples of civic engagement as what you do directly affects the community.
When civic engagement is a part of an academic program, and the learners' engagement is assessed following a scale, then it is called service learning. It involves the application of knowledge and skills learned in the classroom and then making a complete plan of action 1.e. preparing a budget, starting the process of implementation, involving people and activating operational strategies.

sub_questions.explanation: Education plays a vital role in bringing about positive changes in behaviour. It helps us try to change our life as well as our society. Complete education not only illuminates our minds but also inspires us to work for the community. The purpose of education is not getting grades and receiving certificates. The main objective of education is to make life better. Civic engagement of the learners is highly appreciated all over the world nowadays. A civically engaged person works to create a difference in the civic life taking action or raising voice against injustice, discrimination and other forms of social ills. When we work for social welfare, we are civically engaged. Civic engagement may be individual or group activities. For example, we can raise voice against raising excessive taxes. This protest can be done by organising ralles, collecting signature, making human chains, etc. Learners engagement is evaluated by following a scale. Rnowledge and skills learned in the school is applied. in society for public welfare.

questions.uddipok:
Write a summary of the following passage:
Famous Hollywood actress, Angelina Jolie, came to Bangladesh as United Nations High Commission for Refugees (UNHCR)'s special envoy to express her solidarity with the Rohingya refugees in February 2019. She visited the refugees in their camps and talked to them, and spent time with some children in their school.She came to know about the atrocities the Rohingya refugees had faced in their villages in the Arakan state of Myanmar. Visiting the world's largest refugee settlement, Ms. Jolie called for expanded access to education for Rohingya children. Afterwards she urged for an end to injustices that had driven nearly one million Rohingyas into exile in Bangladesh.
Addressing the refugees in the camp, the UNHCR special envoy said, "I want to say I am humbled and proud to stand with you today. You have every right to live in security, to be free to practice your religion and to coexist with people of other faiths and ethnicities. You have every right not to be stateless, and the way you have been treated shames us all."

sub_questions.explanation: Angelina Jolie, expressed her heartfelt concern for Rohingya refugees during a visit to a refugee camp. Deeply moved by their plight and disheartened by their treatment, she called for increased access to education and an end to injustice. She emphasized their rights to live in their state, practice their religion, and coexist peacefully with others.

questions.uddipok:
The following sentences are jumbled. Re-write them in the proper order and in a continuous paragraph to make a story.
(a) She was determined to become an astronaut.
(b) She did her graduation in Aeronautical Engineering.
(c) She joined NASA and began working as a Vice President.
(d) She obtained her Master's degree in Aerospace Engineering.
(e) Kalpana Chawla was the first Indian born astronaut.
(f) Her first space mission (STS) began in 1997.
(g) She did her Ph.D. in Aerospace Engineering.
(h) After a 16 days scientific mission in space, the space shuttle Columbia broke down and all the crew including Kalpana Chawla died.
(i) Her second space mission (STS) began in 2003.
(j) After getting US citizenship she started her career as a NASA astronaut.

sub_questions.explanation:
(e)→ (b)→ (d)→(g) → (a)→ (c) (j)→(f)→(i)→(h)
Kalpana Chawla was the first Indian-born astronaut. She did her graduation in Aeronautical Engineering. She obtained her Master's degree in Aerospace Engineering. She did her Ph.D. in Aerospace Engineering. She was determined to become an astronaut. She joined NASA and began working as a Vice President. After getting US. citizenship, she started her career as a NASA astronaut. Her first space mission (STS) began in 1997. Her second space mission (STS) began in 2003. After a 16 days scientific mission in space, the space shuttle Colombia broke down and all the crew including Kalpana Chawla died.
